class ModelPLCB

Detailed Description

This class manages a model.

There is only one instance of this class for each model file, as it represents only the static data of a model. Dynamic data is stored in the referencing SuperModel file.

const ModelAction * Model::getAction ( const std::string &  name  )  const

This method gets the pointer to the input action name in this model's table.

Actions only make sense in the context of the most derived model in a SuperModel (i.e. the top lod one), so we don't have to do any tricks with indices here. Of course, the animations referenced by these actions still do this.

Returns:
the action, or NULL if not found

int Model::getAnimation ( const std::string &  name  )  const

This method gets the index of the input animation name in this model's table.

The index is also valid for all the ancestors and descendants of this model.

Returns:
the index of the animation, or -1 if not found

ModelDye Model::getDye ( const std::string &  matterName,
const std::string &  tintName,
Tint **  ppTint = NULL 
)

This method gets a (packed) index of the dye formed by the given matter and tint names.

If ppTint is not NULL, and the dye is found, then the pointer to the tint in the local model is written into ppTint.

int Model::getPropInCatalogue ( const char *  name  )  [static]

This static method returns the index of the property with the given name in the global property catalogue.

It returns -1 if a property of that name does not exist.

ModelActionsIterator Model::lookupLocalActionsEnd (  )  const

ModelAnimation * Model::lookupLocalAnimation ( int  index  ) 

This method gets the animation that is most local to this model for the given index.

It does not return the default animation if the index cannot be found - instead it returns NULL.

ModelAnimation* Model::lookupLocalDefaultAnimation (  )  [inline]

const Matter * Model::lookupLocalMatter ( int  index  )  const

This method looks up the local matter of the given index.

const char * Model::lookupPropName ( int  index  )  [static]

This static method looks up the name of the given property in the global property catalogue.

There is no method to look up the value and return a pointer to it as that would not be thread safe. Returns NULL if the index is out of range.

int  flags

This method plays the animation with the given index.

void Model::postLoad ( DataSectionPtr  pFile  )  [protected]

This method loads stuff that is common to all model types but must be done after the rest of the model has been loaded - i.e.

actions.

static SimpleMutex& Model::propCatalogueLock (  )  [inline, static]

static PropCatalogue& Model::propCatalogueRaw (  )  [inline, static]

int Model::readDyes ( DataSectionPtr  pFile,
bool  multipleMaterials 
) [protected]

This method loads a model's dyes, if it has them.

If multipleMaterials is true, then it calls the derived model to search for searches for material names in its bulk. Otherwise the dyes are read as if for a billboard model, which can have only one material (and thus dyes must each be composited).

bool Model::readSourceDye ( DataSectionPtr  pSourceDye,
DyeSelection &  dsel 
) [protected]

This method reads the source dye described in the given data section into a DyeSelection object.

Returns:
true for success

ModelPtr Model::reload ( DataSectionPtr  pFile = NULL,
bool  reloadChildren = true 
) const

This method reloads the referenced model - and returns a new model.

The old model is not deleted, but future calls to the static 'get' method (and thus future SuperModel instantiations) will return the new model.

Note:
The same model can be reloaded more than once, i.e. this model needn't be the one in the model map used by 'get'

const std::string& Model::resourceID (  )  const [inline]

void Model::setStaticLighting ( ModelStaticLightingPtr  pLighting  ) 

This is the base class method to set static lighting.

uint32 Model::sizeInBytes (  )  const

This method returns the size of this Model in bytes.

void Model::soak ( const ModelDye &  dye  )  [virtual]

This method soaks this model in the given (packed) dye index.

It is a default method for model classes that use multiple materials.

void Model::soakDyes (  ) 

This method soaks the Model's materials in the currently emulsified dyes, or the default for each matter if it has no emulsion.

It is a utility method called by models that use multiple materials to implement their dyes.

void Model::tickAnimation ( int  index,
float  dtime,
float  otime,
float  ntime 
)

This method ticks the animation with the given index if it exists.

bool Model::valid (  )  const [virtual]

This function returns true if the Model is in a valid state.

This function will not raise a critical error or asserts if called but may commit ERROR_MSGs to the log.

Returns:
Returns true if the animation is in a valid state, otherwise false.

Reimplemented in NodefullModel, SwitchedModel< BULK >, and SwitchedModel< SmartPointer< Visual > >.

virtual const BoundingBox& Model::visibilityBox (  )  const [pure virtual]

Implemented in NodefullModel, and NodelessModel.
